description: MCP Server Configuration for RASA Chatbot

adaptive_card.description: Create custom Adaptive Cards from natural language descriptions. Use for designing dashboards, profiles, notifications, forms, and any visual card layouts.

generate_adaptive_card.system_instruction: Use adaptive_card.generate_adaptive_card when user wants to CREATE, DESIGN, BUILD, or MAKE any kind of visual card including: dashboards, profiles, notifications, forms, articles. Pass the user's description and optional tone (professional/friendly/bold/minimal).
generate_adaptive_card.code_example: result = await call_tool('adaptive_card.generate_adaptive_card', {'description': 'quarterly sales dashboard with revenue metrics', 'tone': 'professional'})

get_card_template.system_instruction: Use adaptive_card.get_card_template to show available card types and features.

leave.description: Employee leave validation and balance checking

analyze_leave_request.system_instruction: For ANY leave/vacation/time-off/PTO request, ALWAYS use leave.analyze_leave_request with the user's full message. This tool intelligently extracts dates and leave type, then either shows a pre-filled form (if info is missing) or validates directly (if all info provided).
analyze_leave_request.code_example: result = await call_tool('leave.analyze_leave_request', {'query': 'I want sick leave from Dec 4 to Dec 12'})

validate_leave.system_instruction: Use leave.validate_leave ONLY when processing form submissions with explicit employee_id, dates, and leave_type already extracted.

get_leave_balance.system_instruction: Use leave.get_leave_balance when user asks about remaining leave days, PTO balance, or how many days off they have.

brochure.description: Professional brochure content generation with images using LLM and Google Image Search

generate_brochure.system_instruction: Use brochure.generate_brochure ONCE when user wants to create a brochure. Pass ONLY a simple string as the 'topic' parameter (e.g., 'Hampi' or 'Riyadh Season'). Do NOT pass dict/object. Do NOT call this tool with previous results. The tool returns an adaptive_card that renders automatically.

get_brochure_template.system_instruction: Use brochure.get_brochure_template when user asks what a brochure contains or wants to see the brochure structure.

knowledgebase.description: INDIAN BUDGET SPEECH Q&A - Use for questions about Indian Union Budget, tax structure, tax slabs, tax brackets, Finance Minister speech, government fiscal policies, ministry allocations, schemes, and budget documents. NOT for database/sales/employee queries.

knowledgebase_query.system_instruction: Use knowledgebase.knowledgebase_query ONLY for questions about INDIAN BUDGET SPEECH and GOVERNMENT DOCUMENTS. This includes: Union Budget allocations, Finance Minister announcements, ministry-wise expenditure, government schemes (PM Yojana, Ayushman Bharat, etc.), fiscal deficit, GDP targets, tax policies, infrastructure spending, welfare programs. DO NOT use for database queries about sales, products, customers, employees, or business data - use sql.sql_query for those instead.
knowledgebase_query.code_example:
result = await call_tool('knowledgebase.knowledgebase_query', {'query': 'What is the budget allocation for education sector?', 'state_id': 'session123'})
data = json.loads(result)
print(data.get('answer', 'No answer found'))

knowledgebase_health.system_instruction: Use knowledgebase.knowledgebase_health to check the status of the knowledge base system.

sql.description: DATABASE QUERIES - Use for retrieving/querying existing business data: sales, products, customers, employees, orders, invoices, inventory, revenue analytics. Converts natural language to SQL and executes against PostgreSQL database. NOT for creating cards/dashboards/forms (use adaptive_card), NOT for budget speech, tax structure, or government policy questions.

sql_query.system_instruction: Use sql.sql_query for ALL questions about BUSINESS DATABASE DATA including: sales figures, product information, customer details, employee records, orders, invoices, inventory levels, revenue reports, performance metrics, AND VISUALIZATIONS (pie charts, bar charts, line graphs, tables). Keywords: sales, products, customers, employees, orders, invoices, revenue, profit, how many, top 10, best sellers, total, average, count, chart, pie chart, bar chart, visualize, graph. The tool handles chart generation INTERNALLY - just pass your natural language query and the tool will return both data AND visualization. DO NOT use matplotlib or plt in your code - the sql_query tool handles all visualization internally.
sql_query.code_example:
# For data queries AND visualizations (charts, graphs, etc.)
result = await call_tool('sql.sql_query', {'query': 'Create a pie chart of all product categories', 'state_id': 'session123'})
if result['success']:
    data = result['data']
    print(data.get('answer', 'Query completed'))
else:
    print(f"Error: {result.get('error')}")

sql_schema.system_instruction: Use sql.sql_schema to get database schema information including table names and column definitions.

sql_health.system_instruction: Use sql.sql_health to check the database connection status.

secure_rag.description: INTERNAL COMPANY DATA ONLY: Query employee records, HR policies, company documents. NOT for general knowledge questions like 'What is Python?' - those go to chat. NOT for collecting user's personal details like 'collect my info' - those go to contact_form.

secure_query.system_instruction: Use secure_rag.secure_query ONLY for INTERNAL COMPANY DATA: employees (like Akash, Arpan), HR policies, company documents. DO NOT use for general knowledge questions (What is Python?, How does ML work?) - those should use the chat tool instead. ALWAYS provide 'user_id' of the person ASKING (e.g., 'emp1', 'hr_admin').
secure_query.code_example: result = await call_tool('secure_rag.secure_query', {'query': 'What is the role of Akash?', 'user_id': 'emp1'})

check_user_access.system_instruction: Use secure_rag.check_user_access ONLY to debug permissions of a SYSTEM USER (hr_admin, emp1). Do NOT use this to find info about people mentioned in documents.

ingest_documents.system_instruction: Use secure_rag.ingest_documents to add new documents to the knowledge base with security metadata (owner_ids, shared, category, sensitivity_level, department).

list_users.system_instruction: Use secure_rag.list_users to see all available users and their roles in the RBAC system.

get_system_stats.system_instruction: Use secure_rag.get_system_stats to get statistics about users, documents, and access rules.

_comment: Set 'enabled': true for servers you want to use. Environment variables like ${VAR} will be expanded from your .env file.
